title: Kelly Clarkson didn't know Meghan Markle's name when quizzed by Ellen DeGeneres: 'She's a princess'
text:
Kelly Clarkson couldn't recall Meghan Markle's name during an appearance on "The Ellen Show" on Monday.

During a game of "Hot Hands," Ellen DeGeneres asked the singer to name the celebrities who appeared on a big screen, and then reveal what question she would ask them if she had the chance.

Kelly Clarkson on "The Ellen Show." Ellen

She proved herself an expert on pop royalty, swiftly naming Justin Timberlake, Miley Cyrus, and Jennifer Lopez — but paused when shown a photo of actual royalty.

"I know this one, she's a princess," she said.

After DeGeneres whispered the answer, Clarkson said: "Meghan Markle! Oh, she was on 'Suits.'

"Actually, I love 'Suits,'" she added. "I don't know why she doesn't look like a Meghan to me. Maybe I would ask her about that.

"But I would ask, what are the stresses of being a princess?"

It's worth noting that Markle isn't officially recognized as a princess — her royal title is "The Duchess of Sussex."

However, her job title was listed as "Princess of the United Kingdom" on Archie's birth certificate, so Clarkson's not enitrely wrong.

It's no coincidence that DeGeneres included Markle in the quiz, as the pair appear to have become close recently.

The talk show host recently spoke about her time visiting the duchess and Prince Harry in London, and said she even got to feed baby Archie.

Read more: Ellen DeGeneres says she got to hold baby Archie, who 'looks just like Harry' and had more hair than she did when they met

"I can't tell you how sweet they are, but the most important thing is I got to hold little Archie, the baby," she said on "The Ellen Show."

"I fed Archie, I held Archie. He looks just like Harry, and he had more hair than I did at the time. I spent a lot of my summer growing my hair out, but I'll tell you about that tomorrow."

DeGeneres also hinted that there could be a possible working collaboration with the royals in the future.

Praising Harry and Markle's work on wildlife conservation, she said: "We're all gonna do something together."
